This pain characterize `` trigger point '' ( exquisitely tender spot ) group tense muscle fiber extend trigger point muscle attachment . Trigger point trapezius , large muscle lie neck shoulder , typically cause emotional stress , posture hunch shoulder , certain activity like use telephone receiver without elbow support , wear certain article heavy coat heavy purse . Microdialysis use thin needle probe ( size shape acupuncture needle ) collect measure chemical directly soft tissue . Analysis chemical show whether change tissue around muscle trigger point confine muscle , change also occur distant muscle . The study examine two type trigger point . An `` active '' trigger point cause pain abnormal symptom often cause problem movement . A `` latent '' trigger point often cause movement problem without cause pain . Many healthy adult latent trigger point . People 21 65 year age follow characteristic may eligible study : 1 ) neck pain trigger point either upper trapezius muscle ; 2 ) neck pain latent trigger point least one upper trapezius muscle ; 3 ) neck pain le 3 month ' duration active trigger point least one upper trapezius muscle . Participants undergo follow procedure : - Physical examination muscle neck shoulder area , test strength range motion , response palpation find trigger point . - Pain inventory . Subjects complete questionnaire measure pain intensity , location , quality , cause , reliever , associate symptom . The questionnaire fill microdialysis procedure . - Microdialysis upper trapezius muscle . DOC.brief_title: The Natural History Upper Trapezius Myofascial Trigger Points : Comparison Local Remote Tissue Milieu Normal Muscle , Latent Active Myofascial Trigger Points Over Time
DOC.detailed_description: Preliminary data suggest patient active myofascial trigger point ( MTrPs ) significantly different biochemical profile within local milieu MTrPs compare without MTrPs latent ( non-symptomatic ) MTrP . An important question answer whether anatomical locus , remote active latent MTrPs similar biochemical profile MTrP . These remote site evaluate help distinguish whether MTrPs local biochemical profile associate widespread phenomenon . We select three group subject base follow characteristic [ 1 , 2 , 3 ] . We sample GB-21 upper trapezius muscle LV-7 ( posterior inferior medial condyle tibia upper portion medial gastrocnemius ) standardize site pH , muscle metabolite , inflammatory mediator , arachidonic acid derivative , neuropeptides , etc . The goal study determine whether local biochemical milieu active MTrP biochemical milieu anatomical site remote MTrP . The acupuncture point GB-21 LV-7 select specifically standardize location sample point three carefully select group : 1. healthy subject without neck pain MTrPs identify palpation bilaterally GB-21 , MTrPs identify palpation bilaterally LV-7 , 2. healthy subject without neck pain latent MTrPs identify palpation GB-21 one upper trapezius muscle , MTrPs indentified palpation bilaterally LV-7 , 3. healthy subject complain neck pain le 3 month duration active MTrPs identify palpation GB-21 one upper trapezius muscle , MTrPs identify palpation bilaterally LV-7 .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : A total 24 adult expect accrued ( 8 group ; Normal , Latent Active ) age 1865 , without pain continuous idiopathic cervical pain le 3 month duration . EXCLUSION CRITERIA : Fibroymaylgia . Cervical radiculopathy . Lumbrosacral radiculopathy . Atypical facial neuralgia . History trigger point injection upper trapezius muscle . History cervical spine shoulder surgery . History previous trigger point injection medial gastrocnemius muscle . History knee knee amputation . History total knee arthroplasty . History bleed disorder . Subjects anticoagulation therapy . If subject take aspirin within 3 day needle . Tobacco smoker . Other concurrent pain syndrome . On NSAID , COX2 inhibitor , TCA , narcotic , antiepilectic , muscle relaxant , ancetaminophen medication purpose pain relief . Subjects inoordinate fear needle . HEENT infection . Cancer . Knee pain . History DVT . History Baker 's Cyst . History Myopathy . History meniscal tear . History anterior cruciate ligament/posterior cruciate ligament/medial collateral ligament/lateral collateral ligament tear . History knee surgery . History Achilles pathology rupture .
